refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The ssoadm command provides a rich command-line interface for configuring OpenAM core services.
Also see the Installation Guide procedure, To Set Up Administration Tools for instructions on setting up the ssoadm command.

refsect1.title: Global Options
refsect1.para: The following global options are supported.

listitem.para: Run in debug mode. Results sent to the debug file.
Print usage.
This command can also be used with subcommands as in ssoadm subcommand --help.
Print basic information about the tool.
Name of the locale to display the results.
Run in verbose mode. Results sent to standard output.
Print the version of this tool.

refsect1.title: Subcommands: By Category
refsect1.para: This section lists subcommands by category. The subsequent section lists subcommands in alphabetical order with a short description.
See ssoadm subcommand --help for detailed options.

itemizedlist.para: To translate settings applied in OpenAM console to service attributes for use with ssoadm, login to the OpenAM console as as amadmin and access the services page, such as http://openam.example.com:8080/openam/services.jsp.

refsect2.title: ssoadm add-agent-to-grp
refsect2.para: Add agents to a agent group.

listitem.para: Administrator ID of running the command.
Name of agent group.
Names of agents.
File name that contains password of administrator.
Name of realm.
Administrator ID of running the command.
Directory Server base distinguished name.
File that contains password of bind password.
Directory Server bind distinguished name.
directory servers <protocol>://<hostname>:<port>. Can have multiple entries.
File that contains password of the dsameuser
File name that contains password of administrator.

Organization objects naming attribute (defaults to 'o')
User objects naming attribute (defaults to 'uid')

refsect2.title: ssoadm add-app-priv
refsect2.para: Add an application privilege to delegate resources of a given application.

listitem.para: Possible values are READ, MODIFY, DELEGATE, ALL
Administrator ID of running the command.
Application name
Name for the this delegation
File name that contains password of administrator.
Realm name
Subject name
Possible values are User or Group
Description for the this delegation.
Resources to delegate, All resources in the applications will be delegated if this option is absent.

Module Name.

Name of realm.

Position where the new entry is to be added. This is option is not set, entry shall be added to the end of the list. If value of this option is 0, it will be inserted to the front of the list. If value is greater of the length of the list, entry shall be added to the end of the list.
